qas.question: What did Apple begin to eliminate in 2002?
Why was the new iMac G4 considerably more expensive than the G3?

answers.text: higher cost of the LCD technology

qas.question: Who did Apple create the more affordable eMac in April 2002 for?
What was the main problem with the eMac's CRT?
After Apple's failed desktop sales, what products drove their sales growth?

answers.text: the iPod portable music player and iTunes music download service

qas.question: What did Apple begin to eliminate in 2012?

plausible_answers.text: higher cost of the LCD technology

qas.question: Why was the new iMac G4 considerably more expensive than the G5?
Who did Apple create the more affordable eMac in April 2003 for?
What was the main problem with the iMac's CRT?
After Microsoft's failed desktop sales, what products drove their sales growth?

context: Starting in 2002, Apple moved to eliminate <a0_0><b5_0>CRT displays<b5_0/><a0_0/> from its product line as part of aesthetic design and space-saving measures with the iMac G4. However, the new iMac with its flexible LCD flat-panel monitor was considerably more expensive on its debut than the preceding iMac G3, largely due to the <a1_0><b6_0>higher cost of the LCD technology<b6_0/><a1_0/> at the time. In order to keep the Macintosh affordable for <a2_0><b7_0>the education market<b7_0/><a2_0/> and due to obsolescence of the iMac G3, Apple created the eMac in April 2002 as the intended successor; however the eMac's CRT made it <a3_0><b8_0>relatively bulky and somewhat outdated<b8_0/><a3_0/>, while its all-in-one construction meant it could not be expanded to meet consumer demand for larger monitors. The iMac G4's relatively high prices were approaching that of laptops which were portable and had higher resolution LCD screens. Meanwhile, Windows PC manufacturers could offer desktop configurations with LCD flat panel monitors at prices comparable to the eMac and at much lower cost than the iMac G4. The flop of the Power Mac G4 Cube, along with the more expensive iMac G4 and heavy eMac, meant that Macintosh desktop sales never reached the market share attained by the previous iMac G3. For the next half-decade while Macintosh sales held steady, it would instead be <a4_0>the <b9_0>iPod portable music player<b9_0/> and iTunes music download service<a4_0/> that would drive Apple's sales growth.
